item.title: 'Burnham coup plot' and Tories vow to 'ditch ban on petrol cars'
item.description: Labour Mayor Andy Burnham's ambition to return to Parliament and a Tory pledge to scrap a 2030 ban on petrol cars lead the papers.

item.title: We asked Mormons what they really think about The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives
item.description: Those in the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Britain tell BBC News about their lives, after the Disney+ show was laced with scandal.

item.title: He was an Uber driver in the US. Now he's scared of jihadists after deportation to Somalia
item.description: As some Somali migrants fear what might happen next, the BBC speaks to one deportee in Mogadishu.

item.title: From bland to bold - how these women are ditching beige to spark joy
item.description: From kitsch mirrors to neon pink walls, a pop of colour could brighten up your winter.

item.title: 'Burnham coup plot' and UK faces 'tsunami of flu'
item.description: Claims of Labour Mayor Andy Burnham's "plot" to enter Commons and a spike of flu cases leads the Sunday papers.

item.title: Supermarket skincare dupes could save you hundreds. But do budget beauty products work?
item.description: Budget-friendly alternatives to high-end products often have similar names and packaging, but the ingredients can vary significantly.

item.title: Everyone is invited to be the fourth Haim sister
item.description: As they celebrate an historic Grammy nomination, Haim say everyone is welcome to join their band.

item.title: He created Grand Theft Auto. Now he's back with a novel about an AI that hijacks your mind
item.description: A Better Paradise is a dystopian vision of the near future in which an AI-led computer game goes rogue.

item.title: First it was K-pop, now it's K-food. Here's how to bring Korean cooking into your kitchen
item.description: Why jars of kimchi and bottles of gochujang are turning Korean food into a UK staple.

item.title: 'A nightmare' - The battle over Warner Bros is turning Hollywood upside down
item.description: Interviews with dozens of actors, producers and camera crews reveal an industry attempting to weigh the lesser of two horrible choices.

item.title: Binge-watching 2025's Christmas films: The good, the bad and the so-bad-it's-good
item.description: Kiefer Sutherland, Michelle Pfeiffer and Kate Winslet all star in new festive films this Christmas.
